13.title: L'Irrésistible Ascension
13.author: Serge Clerc.
notes: (Serge Clerc Spéciale Collection ; no. 1)

14.title: "L'Irrésistible Ascension de l'Édition Indépendante"
14.author: Jean-Philippe Martin
14.appears_in: p. 22-31 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 5 (Jan. 2000).
notes: (Dossier : Un Bilan des Années 90).

Begins: "Présents pour la première fois sur un même stand au Salon du Livre de Paris in 1999, une vingtaine de petits éditeurs francophones, comptant parmi les plus actifs comme Amok, Cornélius, Ego comme X, Fréon et bien sûr l'Association, venaient prouver du haut de leurs 500 ouvrages publiés en l'espace de 10 ans, qu'au-delà des plus folles espérances, un véritable renouveau de la bande dessinée de création avait trouvé à s'incarner. Un dossier tirant le bilan des années 1990 exigeait que l'on revînt sur la montée en puissance de ce que l'on désigne souvent comme 'l'édition indépendante' (qu'il serait peut-être plus juste d'appeler, tout simplement, 'les petits éditeurs').

English summary (from p. 150): "The Irresistible Ascension of the Independent Publishers. Amok, the Association, La Cinquième couche, Cornélius, Ego comme X, Fréon, the Requins marteau, 6 Pieds sous Terre: these are some of the main independent publishers that have emerged during the last decade. Small organizations, often founded and run by creators, they maintain an uncompromising conception of creation and produce objects that are distinct from the traditional album. Their rise has been steady, as Jean-Philippe Martin shows. He predicts they will influence the future of comics in general."

15.heading: "The Irresistible Ascension of the Independent Publishers."

Un dossier tirant le bilan des années 1990 exigeait que l'on revînt sur la montée en puissance de ce que l'on désigne souvent comme 'l'édition indépendante' (qu'il serait peut-être plus juste d'appeler, tout simplement, 'les petits éditeurs').

English summary (from p. 150): "The Irresistible Ascension of the Independent Publishers. Amok, the Association, La Cinquième couche, Cornélius, Ego comme X, Fréon, the Requins marteau, 6 Pieds sous Terre: these are some of the main independent publishers that have emerged during the last decade. Small organizations, often founded and run by creators, they maintain an uncompromising conception of creation and produce objects that are distinct from the traditional album. Their rise has been steady, as Jean-Philippe Martin shows. He predicts they will influence the future of comics in general."

Lorna ties him up and puts a metal helmet on his head, so at least the adventures happen only to himself.

131.heading: Irwin Troll.
131.title: "Checkmate!"
131.author: by R
notes: Summary: Irwin seems to have won, so Gaylord shouldn't call him dumb anymore, except they're playing Monopoly.

132.heading: Irwin Troll.
132.title: "Guys, I'm Going to Need Those Forms Back"
132.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Irwin the census taker has counted three million for the day because he found an ant colony. He didn't realize it was only for humans.

133.heading: Irwin Troll.
133.title: "I Hate Astroturf!"
133.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda and Irwin are alone in a football stadium, and she's getting ready to give him a carpetshock.

134.heading: Irwin Troll.
134.title: "I Thought It Was A Mirror"
134.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda is grossed out by what she sees in the pet store window; Irwin tells her it's a Shar-Pei.

135.heading: Irwin Troll.
135.title: "If I Were You, I'd Cut Down on Calcium"
135.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: A golf ball hits Irwin on the head while he's standing under a bird in a nest.

136.heading: Irwin Troll.
136.title: "It's a big Advantage When You Think High Score Wins"
136.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Irwin doesn't get frustrated by golf.

137.heading: Irwin Troll.
137.title: "Next Time Don't Make It Out of Bathroom Tissue"
137.author: by Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Irwin has made himself a turban to look sinister and mysterious, but it doesn't work in the rain.

138.heading: Irwin Troll.
138.title: "Snooze Alarm"
138.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda zaps Irwin when he tries to wake her, so that it takes him a little time to try again.

139.heading: Irwin Troll.
139.title: "An Unusually Pesky Year for Deer!"
139.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Irwin's building a fence, while behind him the deer have dynamite and a bulldozer.

140.heading: Irwin Troll.
140.title: "You Can Have a Ton of Fun Without Ever Hitting the Ball!"
140.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Irwin enjoys watching Broom-Hilda try to play golf.

141.heading: Irwyn.

141.author: Irwyn
